page.description: Returns a date value. Errors if date is out of range
page.syntax: Date_Value as D = date_value(N year ,N month ,N day )

argument.name: year
argument.description: The four digit integer representation of a year. Numeric

argument.name: month
argument.description: The one or two digit integer representation of a month. Numeric

argument.name: day
argument.description: The one or two digit integer representation of a day of the month. Numeric

page.discussion: DATE_VALUE() returns a Date_Value for the specified year, month and day. This function is useful because it works regardless of what regional settings (e.g. U.S., United Kingdom, etc.) are in effect.
page.example: date_value(2000,2,1) -> {2/1/2000} (assuming regional settings are set for the U.S). date_value(2000,2,1) -> {1/2/2000} (assuming regional settings are set for the U.K).
